nodes.bodyText: I think for these sort of interfaces, at least until we're on Java 8 someday, we can add a comment like. This is a FunctionalInterface and will not have methods added to it - it is safe to use as a lambda without chance of API breakage. The reason we don't add the annotation is we target Java 7.

nodes.bodyText: A good point. But, if I'm going ahead with changing the API for #1580 , this one won't be so nice and simple any more, but have lots of methods on it. The LabelConsumer is a different story, though, as I think it will stay simple.

nodes.bodyText: I don't quite follow the PR description about clashing with Map - we don't inherit from Map so there's no clash right?
The issue is with the AttributeMap used in the RecordEventsReadableSpan. It does extend Map, and the get method on Map clashes with what this has now.
I updated the PR description with some details that I realized was missing for people other than me. :)
Maybe a better answer is to finally rip off the bandaid, and make the AttributesMap not extend HashMap.
@anuraaga I made AttributesMap not extend HashMap anymore, and restored the get name. Please take a look!

This will be needed when we switch the key type, since they won't be strings any more. The prototype didn't mess with the underlying implementation, but just stuck with Maps for demo simplicity (note the TODOs in the prototype code).
I updated the PR description with some details that I realized was missing for people other than me. :)

I think it's worth returning the existing item like Map since it's familiar and opens more use cases without extra work. It's not backwards-compatible to change return value of a method unfortunately.
That's fair. I'll make it so.
although, this is an internal, non-public class, so I don't think it actually matters much. :)
Oops haha. Yeah then no worries at all
